entry.title: Cleanup ResourceRequestSender.
entry.content:
This CL removes ResourceRequestSender.should_follow_redirect and

PostTask() logic in ResourceRequestSender::OnReceivedRedirect().



`should_follow_redirect` was introduced by crrev.com/c/1007625. It was

set to false when handling a navigation request. But this logic was

removed by crrev.com/c/2115459. So `should_follow_redirect` is always

true after that.



The PostTask() logic in ResourceRequestSender::OnReceivedRedirect() was

introduced by crrev.com/c/1159821 to handle synchronous

OnReceiveRedirect() call in ThrottlingURLLoader::StartNow(). But after

crrev.com/c/2011221, ThrottlingURLLoader::StartNow() asynchronously

calls OnReceiveRedirect() using PostTask(). So we don't need the

PostTask() logic in ResourceRequestSender::OnReceivedRedirect().



Bug: 1379780

Change-Id: I87953a1754a64c8429e3d0db5b0383ce93ac7a29

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4875755

Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

Commit-Queue: Tsuyoshi Horo

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1198196}

entry.title: LCPP: Factor out the logic to update LCP string frequency stat data.
entry.content:
For ease of reusing the algorithm, let me factor out the logic outside

of the `RecordSingleLcpInfluencerScriptUrlHistogram`.

The fields in the structure has already been renamed to something

general names.



I plan to send a series of CLs for this refactoring.

1. factor out the update logic.

2. factor out the logic to convert from/to the protobuf struct.

3. merge LcpElementLocatorStat to this.



I believe Chromium uses the binary representation protocol buffer,

and changing the human readable name does not bring any breakage there.



Change-Id: If4302afd246d8c17ea460f280d28cf6c130821c7

Bug: 1419756

entry.title: CCA: Release the shutter when take photo failed
entry.content:
CCA use a private api to release the shutter. If VCD gets a shutter

notification, CCA will release the shutter. However, when taking photos

fails, we also need to release CCA's shutter. This CL releases CCA's

shutter when VCD gets error notification and takePhoto callback is not

null in the corresponding pending result.



Bug=b:291534728, b:299864940

Test=Test it with crrev/c/4686142. The shutter is released after this

CL.

entry.title: CCNS BFCache: disallow cache CCNS page when in kiosk mode
entry.content:
In kiosk mode, it's more likely that the device will be shared by

different users. We disable BFCache for CCNS to mitigate the security

risk of leaking sensitive information through back navigation.

entry.title: [fetch-later] Add more mojo guards, and set a TTL on loader
entry.content:
FetchLater is a new API still behind a flag.



This CL extracts partial logic from https://crrev.com/c/4803083

to make it simpler:



1. Add more guards in KeepAliveURLLoaderService to reject

potential invalid requests.

2. Move the calling `KeepAliveURLLoader::Start()` of a deferred

loader ino the loader itself.

3. For every loader, enforce a max timeout (30s) after they are

disconnected from renderer, which is the same as pre-keepalive

migration TTL.



Bug: 1465781

entry.title: Reland "Make the Reading mode side panel a local side panel instead of a global one."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit d5dacbd5bc28d84bbe948719c9f47e91465502ac



The original CL was reverted because it failed linux-chromeos-chrome. In

that failed builder, read_anything_toolbar_view_browsertest crashed

unexpected when initializing a ReadAnythingCoordinator in the

SetUpOnMainThread method (line 62). The crash happened in the

ReadAnythingCoordinator constructor when it called

CreateAndRegisterEntriesForExistingWebContents, a new method I added to

register existing web contents (tabs) to Read Anything Side panel (line

58 in read_anything_coordinator.cc in the original CL). In my update, I

removed this line as well as the

CreateAndRegisterEntriesForExistingWebContents method. This method is

unnecessary because an existing tab will be registered to Read Anything

side panel whenever we switch to that tab in

ReadAnythingCoordinator::OnTabStripModelChanged. After this change,

linux-chromeos-chrome passed and the Read Anything local side panel

still worked correctly.



Original change's description:

> Make the Reading mode side panel a local side panel instead of a global

> one.

>

> Bug: 1439905

> Change-Id: Icdcabd2ddade61c4a32805c9a41668d621993aef

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4756472

> Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

> Reviewed-by: Jocelyn Tran

> Commit-Queue: Xiang Xiao

> Reviewed-by: David Tseng

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1186669}



Bug: 1439905

rootId is moved back to Tab from CriticalPersistedTabData,

reversing the usage of the UserData pattern. This is part of

of CriticalPersistedTabData. This is safe to do since the experiment

entry.title: Always attempt video decoder init if we don't have fallback.
entry.content:
For codecs such as H264, H265 we may not have software fallback

depending on the platform. As such even if OS metadata suggests

the playback will fail, try it anyways because it certainly will

otherwise.



This is useful since the OS metadata doesn't always appear accurate

on Android and may be too expensive to compute accurately on other

platforms (e.g., requires testing resolutions one at a time).



Fixed: 1473863

entry.title: List test/data/ subdirectories for components_unittests
entry.content:
It turns out that by moving a large amount of test data into

components/test/data, the amount of data pushed to Android devices for

content_unittests rose significantly. With this change, we list the

subdirectories explicitly, allowing us to pick and choose which are

actually included for these tests.



This excludes components/test/data/viz. For context, see comments

on crrev.com/c/4296397



credit: thanks to ender@ for flagging this issue and to agrieve@

for pointing out that I'd missed trailing slashes.

entry.content:
This reverts commit 8b86f65768cceae636a87a062cbceac845ea5087.



Reason for revert: Removing unused signals doesn't have any effect on fixing ios-simulator tests. Hence reverting this CL.



Original change's description:

> [Bling Magic Stack] Removing unused signals.

>

> The default model is taking time to return ranking result to the client

> resulting in tests to take more than 5 sec to run. Removing unused

> signals to reduce the time for the model to return result.

entry.title: WebNN: Let command recorder keep command resources alive
entry.content:
This CL intends to fix the buffer leak issue discussed in `ComputeImpl`

CL review [1]. The issue is that the caller, e.g.,

`UploadAndCreateBufferBinding`, may call `ReferenceUntilCompleted()` on

the command queue for buffers it creates during the command recording.

If it fails later, the command queue holds onto those buffers. If there

are no new commands submitted and executed by command queue, these

buffers are leaked.



This CL changes `CommandRecorder` to let it keep the resources used by

recorded commands before submission. Only after the commands submission

succeeds in the `CloseAndExecute()` method, these resources will be

transferred to the command queue who will keep them alive until the GPU

work has been completed. If the command recording fails, the caller

should delete the command recorder that will release the resources.



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4792904/comment/cb1b6faf_317a0009/



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: I8d7cddaf22e96c249d45c3a100e351b35075cf4a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4863792

Reviewed-by: Rafael Cintron

Commit-Queue: ningxin hu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1198138}

entry.title: Fix :has() invalidation bug when removing anchor element's siblings
entry.content:
This CL fixes a :has() invalidation bug when the following conditions

are met:



1. A style rule uses a :has() pseudo class. The :has() test result is

affected by the anchor element's relationship to its sibling

element at fixed distance. (e.g. '.a:has(+ .b) {}')

2. The :has() pseudo class was tested on an anchor element and it

didn't matched.

3. If a sibling of the anchor element is removed, the :has() will

match the anchor element.

(e.g. '
')

4. Remove a sibling of the anchor element so that the :has() matches

the anchor element. (e.g. 'target.remove();')



For the removal, StyleEngine have to schedule :has() invalidation

even if the removed element doesn't have any identifier stored in

RuleFeatureSet. But it is not efficient to schedule :has()

invalidation for every element removal.



To avoid unnecessary :has() invalidation, StyleEngine checks whether

its parent has the 'ChildrenAffectedByDirectAdjacentRules' flag set

or not.



Currently, the SelectorChecker sets the flag only when it consumes

a direct adjacent combinator(+). This works most cases but it doesn't

work in this case (condition #2) because the SelectorChecker stops

the :has() argument selector matching before consuming the direct

adjacent combinator. Due to this, the parent of the anchor element

doesn't have the 'ChildrenAffectedByDirectAdjacentRules' flag set

and the StyleEngine doesn't schedule the :has() invalidation for the

removal.



To fix the error, when the SelectorChecker tests a :has() pseudo

class on an anchor element and the :has() is affected by the anchor

element's relationship to a sibling at fixed distance, the

SelectorChecker sets the flag of the parent to indicate that

StyleEngine need to schedule :has() invalidation whenever any child

of the element is removed.



Bug: 1480643

Change-Id: I5ec2e3c1db2773020368415f68bca1503367e669

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4864627

Commit-Queue: Byungwoo Lee

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1198137}

entry.title: Revert "snap-groups: Record snap two windows duration"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 21ab723529a531aa00d927eeebbde38792aaa6d2.



Reason for revert:

This CL breaks tests, e.g.InputDataProviderTest.BadDeviceDoesNotCrash

https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/38477



Original change's description:

> snap-groups: Record snap two windows duration

>

> This adds metrics that will be used by Snap Groups. We want to record

> the distribution of users snapping a first window then a second window

> on the opposite side within X minutes, where X is very low.

>

> If the first window is unsnapped or closed without a second window

> getting snapped, we will record it as very high, i.e. the max bucket.

>

> Note that this ignores partial ratios, if a user for some reason snaps

> mismatched ratios (e.g. 2/3 left and 1/2 right), it will be recorded.

>

> Test: added

> Fixed: b/299666829

> Change-Id: I1d070466b2fb89971fef988aadcfe133eb46d49a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4854503

> Reviewed-by: Sammie Quon

> Commit-Queue: Sophie Wen

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1197947}

entry.title: [Nearby][Self Share] Add Attachment Type Metrics
entry.content:
Add

Nearby.Share.Payload.{ContactStatus}.AttachmentType{Variation}

to record the Attachment type of a payload transferred with a share target

of contact status {ContactStatus} and transfer trait {Variation}.

entry.title: Call InProgress when pausing GpuWatchdog.
entry.content:
When GpuWatchdog is paused, in addition to invalidating the GpuWatchdog

timeout task and setting |skip_for_pause_|, call InProgress

(ReportProgress) to ensure the Gpu process will not be terminated.

Also hold |skip_lock_| until crash dump is finished to get a correct

crash signature if the GpuWatchdog kill is triggered before

GpuWatchdog pause.

entry.title: [HitTestOpaqueness] Use view scroll as the scroll state of fixed-position layer
entry.content:
Scroll gesture in a fixed-position layer is special in that though

the layer itself doesn't scroll, the gesture should scroll the

viewport. In pre-HitTestOpaqueness, such scrolls are treated as

unreliable and the main thread will scroll the viewport.

In HitTestOpaqueness, a scroll gesture may be reliable in an

hit-test-opaque fixed-layer, and the scroll state of the layer

is now adjusted to be the viewport scroll so that the compositor

can scroll the viewport, instead of crbug.com/1481779.



Bug: 1413877, 1481779

entry.title: Make offscreen canvas draw calls a no-op when the context is lost
entry.content:
Most canvas API entry points check whether the context is valid by

calling GetOrCreatePaintCanvas and aborting if the returned value is

nullptr. For the HTML canvas element, GetOrCreatePaintCanvas returns

nullptr if the context is lost, therefore making all canvas APIs no-op.

The offscreen canvas version of GetOrCreatePaintCanvas however doesn't

do that. As a result, most offscreen canvas API aren't no-op when the

context is lost.



Adding a check for isContextLost in GetOrCreatePaintCanvas means that

TryRestoreContextEvent can't call that method anymore because this code

runs while the context is lost.



Bug: 1478265

Change-Id: I22247fcf71820dea6e76deb96a19d3cdd3accf44

entry.title: pip2: Elide tail for file URLs
entry.content:
This CL changes document picture-in-picture windows to elide the tail

of the origin display for file URLs, since the file name can be made to

look like an origin for spoofing.



We will continue to elide the head of the origin display for HTTPS

URLs, since origins should be head-elided to prevent spoofing.



Bug: 1482045

entry.title: Set flags with float color
entry.content:
Colors were being squashed into integer colors in a few places which

meant that we were losing wide gamut rendering.



Ideally cc::PaintFlags::setColor with int color should be removed

entirely, but that's a lot more work, there is a todo.



wide-gamut-text-border-background-color.html is added to the

virtual/wide-gamut test suite. See

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4873439

to verify that test changes are working as expected.



Without the changes in this CL, the added test fail as expected:

https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8769596775839771633/test-results?q=virtual%2Fwide-gamut%2Fwide-gamut-text-border-background-color.html&sortby=&groupby=

entry.title: Support for user-initiated jobs in background task scheduler
entry.content:
1. FGS for downloads/uploads will be soon deprecated and be replaced by

long running jobs. This CL adds support to specify user-initiated job

type in BackgroundTaskScheduler.

2. A notification must be attached to the job life cycle for user-

initiated jobs. This CL adds a callback to the TaskFinishedCallback

interface. This callback could later be changed to TaskCallback.



There are certain constraints when a user- initiated job is specified,

such as it cannot be periodic or have end-time constraints etc. Android

provides run time error messages when such combination is specified.

Hence we add assertions while constructing the TaskInfo.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Robolectric doesn't support Android 14 yet, but will be soon in a few weeks. Tests are in place to run when that's supported.

entry.title: [DSE] Hide Feeds and its header according to DSE.
entry.content:
In this CL, Feeds and its header will be completely hidden if swapping

out NTP is enabled and DSE isn't Google. Therefore, the following

changes are made in FeedSurfaceMediator:

1. Add Pref:EnableSnippetsByDse to track whether the DSE is Google.

2. Once this pref is changed, we hide or show Feeds and its header.

3. Keep an observer of TemplateUrlService even when Feeds isn't

visible. Updates the pref value when DSE is changed.

Demo:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Q6MV5B2Fh79hyt0lbBaYoSO01H7ngxJP/view?usp=drive_link

entry.title: [SurfacePolish] Add new parameter "scrollable_mvt".
entry.content:
The feature flag ShowScrollableMVTOnNTPAndroid has been used

in experiment "Start Surface on Tablet". Thus, we introduce

another parameter for "Surface Polish" feature flag:

1. Phones: use StartSurfaceConfiguration.SURFACE_POLISH_SCROLLABLE_MVT

2. Tablets: always show 1 row MV tiles.

Tis allows us to change the number of rows of MV tiles without

impacted by the ShowScrollableMVTOnNTPAndroid feature.

Screenshot of chrome://flags:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gzbQk_gU2GBRpqNumDsfLVzPbtXzQK4T3RjzDWPgJRo/edit#bookmark=id.qwwfvdt4te43

entry.title: Add nullptr check for `data_source_provider_`
entry.content:
The destruction sequence for HlsDataSourceProvider first calls Stop()

which resets `data_source_provider_`. This also cancels any pending

network requests, but if those network requests have already finished,

then its possible to continue without aborting and potentially

re-entrantly call ReadFromUrl and NPD on `data_source_provider_`

entry.title: Make AXObject::IsKeyboardFocusable use Element::IsKeyboardFocusable
entry.content:
This was previously a re-implementation of Element::IsKeyboardFocusable,

but after recent refactoring, we should just be able to directly use

the Element version.



In implementing this, I found another semi-issue with

IsKeyboardFocusable on a number of element types: it did not take

`tabindex` into account. That wasn't a problem in practice while

navigating with the keyboard, since focus_controller (at [1]) also

looked at the `tabindex` value and took it into account. But that did

mean `IsKeyboardFocusable()` didn't match the actual focusability.

With this change, it does.



This also cleans up the comment around Element::SupportsFocus().



Fixed: 1444450

entry.title: Android: Dump java stack for CHECK() failures.
entry.content:
Currently, a JNI call that hits a CHECK() failure shows only the native

stack trace. The Java stack can be really helpful though, so this prints

it as well.



It would be nice to be able to print the java stack for other kinds of

crashes, but doing so for CHECK() failures (or LOG(FATAL)) is a good

first step.

Reason for revert: missed special case where the user use corp credential and missed the handler initialization



Original change's description:

> [OOBE] Fix Crash ScreenManager::GetScreen

>

> when the wizard_controller is initialized it starts off with a different

> profile from the user profile. The `IsOobeDrivePinningEnabled()` returns

> false at this point and doesn't include the DrivePinningScreen to

> screen_manager. Later on when the user has passed the login screen and

entry.title: Increase minimum check membership delay to 1 hour after device powerwash
entry.content:
The 28DA use case requires a larger amount of time to update the PSM

use case cache, which allows us to retrieve the correct CM response.



In order to correctly get responses for the 28DA CM, increase the

minimum delay before the first check membership from 10 minutes

to 1 hour. This delay is updated for all existing use cases,

including 1DA, churn cohort, and observation.



BUG=chromium:1449132

entry.title: [StyleBuilder] Create ComputedStyle during TakeStyle()
entry.content:
One of the goals of the StyleBuilder project is to allow memory

and performance experiments with different ComputedStyle

representations, and in particular representations made possible

by ComputedStyle being immutable, and created at a single point

in time.



However, until this CL, ComputedStyleBuilder simply held

a ComputedStyle internally for most of its lifetime, and forwarded

all builder calls to that object. This CL removes that internal

ComputedStyle, and creates it during TakeStyle() instead.



The high level explanation of how this works is that

ComputedStyleBuilder[Base] now holds all top-level DataRefs

plus top-level data directly, and simply copies this over

when it's time to create the ComputedStyle.



This requires a fair bit of template tweaks, because:



- All trivial top-level fields are moved to a struct for

performance reasons.

- Our single top-level Member (the BaseData field) needs

special consideration, and is not part of the struct

mentioned above.



Since the main objective of this CL is to remove the internal

ComputedStyle object, I'd be happy with simply *not* regressing

performance. However, we appear to have a small win [1].

This may be because we no longer incur any write barriers

for our top-level DataRefs (now RawDataRefs), even when they're

Accessed post-initialization.



I tried two other approaches:



- Dropping the Data struct (each field existing directly on

ComputedStyle[Builder]Base). This actually had acceptable

performance, though worse than this CL. [2]

- Splitting the Data struct into two structs, inherited

and non-inherited. This allows more reasonable copying

of fields from the inherited and non-inherited sources

(in the two-source constructor of ComputedStyleBuilderBase),

and performance indeed seemed better [3]. However, it

increased the sizeof(ComputedStyle) by eight bytes,

so it's better to make that trade-off separately.



[1] This CL:



50 trial(s) on each side.



Initial style (µs) Before After Perf 95% CI (BCa)

ECommerce 5321 5288 +0.6% [ -0.9%, +1.8%]

entry.title: The size-adjust descriptor should not scale system fallback fonts.
entry.content:
When creating a system fallback font for a character on Mac, Blink

refers to the font platform data of the primary font. However, the

created system fallback font could be unintentionally scaled where

the size-adjust descriptor scales the primary font. To fix it, we use

the effective size of the font description instead.



Test: external/wpt/css/css-fonts/size-adjust-unicode-range-system-fallback.html

entry.title: [omnibox][doc] Cleanup doc client scoring and simplify caching.
entry.content:
We ran a bunch of experiments years ago, and were on the fence about

launching. We haven't launched yet, and it's not worth it to revisit it.

So this CL finally removes the client scoring code.



This CL also simplifies caching. Before, the provider had to carefully

add and shrink the cache itself. Now, it sets `max_size` and allows the

cache implementation to handle it. The upside is code simplicity. The

downside is the doc provider may now return duplicate matches when the

cache and newest server response contain the same doc; that's fine,

`AutocompleteResult` will dedupe them later.

entry.title: Yield activation when activation a remote cocoa window on macOS 14.
entry.content:
In macOS 14 an application can't generally activate themselves unless

there is clear user intent or the currently active application has

yielded this to the application that tries to activate itself. To

support activating windows in remote cocoa app shim processes, this

adds such a "yield" call when attempting to activate a window in a

remote process. Note that this only works if the currently active

process is chrome itself (and not for example some other app shim),

but that at least is enough for the common case of launching an app

from chrome://apps.
